voicesplitting.voice

Class Voice

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.voice.Voice
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleNoteVoice

    public abstract class Voice
extends java.lang.Object
    A Voice represents a contiguous stream of MidiNotes within a song.

    A SingleNoteVoice is constrained such that two notes may not co-occur at any time, and thus works with MidiNotes.

    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 6 April, 2015

    • Constructor Detail

      • Voice

        public Voice()

    • Method Detail

      • canAddNoteAtTime

        public abstract boolean canAddNoteAtTime(long time,
                       long length)
        Decide if a new note of the given length can be added at the given time.
        Parameters:
        time - The time we wish to check.
        length - The length of the note we want to add.
        Returns:
        True if we can add a note of the given length at the given time. False otherwise.

      • getLastOffsetTime

        public abstract long getLastOffsetTime()
        Get the last offset time of any note in this Voice.
        Returns:
        The last offset time from the last note in the last chord in this Voice.

      • getLastNote

        public abstract MidiNote getLastNote()
        Get the MidiNote in this Voice with the most recent onset time.
        Returns:
        The MidiNote from this Voice with the last onset time.

      • getWeightedLastPitch

        public abstract double getWeightedLastPitch()
        Get the weighted last pitch of this Voice. That is, the most recent pitch of this Voice, looking back VoiceSplittingParameters.PITCH_HISTORY_LENGTH notes, and weighting each one less the further back we look.
        Returns:
        A weighted average of the average pitches of the last VoiceSplittingParameters.PITCH_HISTORY_LENGTH notes or chords, weighing more recent notes or chords higher, or 0 if we have none yet.

      • getNumNotes

        public abstract int getNumNotes()
        Get the number of notes total in this Voice.
        Returns:
        The number of notes in this Voice.

      • getNumNotesCorrect

        public abstract int getNumNotesCorrect()
        Get the number of notes in this Voice which have been assigned to the correct Voice. That is the number which belong to the midi track from which the majority of the notes in this Voice come.
        Returns:
        The number of notes which have been classified to this Voice correctly.
